meanings.definition: To arrange or categorize data in a new order.
meanings.sent1: I need to reindex my bookshelf to put the books in alphabetical order.
meanings.sent2: The librarian had to reindex the library catalog after adding new books.
meanings.sent3: I tried to reindex my messy desk, but it ended up looking even more chaotic!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a jumble of thoughts that needed to be reindexed for clarity.
meanings.sent5: The computer program automatically reindexes the files for faster searching.

meanings.definition: To update an index or list with new information.
meanings.sent1: Please reindex the online database with the latest sales figures.
meanings.sent2: The search engine needs to reindex the website to show recent updates.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally reindexed the wrong column in the spreadsheet, causing confusion.
meanings.sent4: His memory seemed to reindex itself after hearing the familiar song.
meanings.sent5: The librarian had to reindex the card catalog with the new acquisitions.
